title: Question about Ezreal, if that's okay.
body:
Well I just recently purchased Ezreal, because he seems like a fun champ to play.
Is it possible to build both Attack Damage and Ability Power on him, or is it better to just opt to go either Attack Damage or Ability Power.
I'm gaining a liking to playing him alot actually, I usually play him Mid.
Thanks in advance for the help, I appreciate it.

replies.body:
Ezreal sucks unless you are in ranked 5v5s
he deals hardly any dmg when it comes to all ins, so he needs to poke people down before fighting, in solo queue people seem to be all about all ins, so you are better off using Graves/Vayne/Corki
He has one of the strongest all ins during laning phase and at full build lol?!?!? Let's not forgot to add that he doesn't rely on crits for late game dmg unlike all current meta ADCs.
pft, most of ezreals damage is negated just by standing behind your supp or minions, and his all in compares nothing to Graves/Vayne/Draven
Hmmm I'd explain to you why you're wrong but I think it's safe to assume you have literally no idea about botlane matchups and it would be wasted energy in doing so.

lets be real Ezreal is a great ADC. Love him. Gr8 r8 8/8 m8 would bang. XD jks {{champion:81}} . He actually can do a sh*t tone in a team fight if he doesn't get too close. Graves/Vayne/Corki, all falling off now.
also we have enough try hard degenerate pleb ezreals, don't add to the list

Hybrid can work, but you don't really get the best of both worlds. Sure, it makes it difficult to itemise against him, but your damage output will be lackluster. 
It's generally best to build either AP or AD, not hybrid. 
That said, people generally won't have an issue if you go for a silly build in normals or whatever, like AP Nasus or something.
That's true, but don't forget, Dragon buff gives you both AD *and* AP, so if you're playing Ez, then you might want to apply some more pressure to that objective.

In normals most people tolerate unconventional builds **IF **you are somehow managing it ok - good. Or at least you don't end up with something like 3/10 and possibly be one of the reasons to the team's loss.

If the undesired happens, prepare to take the shower in the end game chat, while probably getting reported.
AD as ADC (obviously) and AP in Mid. Though a tri force works in both lanes.

Well I do tend to go the Attack Damage way if I have to pick tbh. Although I haven't tried it much yet, I'll build all AD items, {{item:3078}}  but get an {{item:3003}} just for that bit extra AP damage.
